subject: Gardening
title: Trees That Warn Each Other
description: One-minute skill: Trees That Warn Each Other.

hook.text: When a giraffe chews an acacia tree, neighboring acacias start producing toxinsâ€”before being touched.

buildup.text: Damaged acacia leaves release ethylene gas into the air. Downwind trees detect it within minutes.

discovery.text: Warned trees ramp up tannin production, making their leaves bitter and potentially lethal to grazers.

twist.text: Giraffes learned the trick. They walk upwind to eat, avoiding the alarm signal entirely.

climax.text: An arms race between trees and grazers has produced plant communication sophisticated enough to have a counter-strategy.

punchline.text: Trees gossipâ€”and giraffes learned to eavesdrop.
